reviewText:
This key was obtained from the publisher for the purposes of review.

Target Audience:    Top-Down Shooter fans who want something different, but are willing to deal with repetition.

Video Review:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70ro79ago5E

Summary:
This is a sale target in my mind. It gets a recommend because it's worth picking up at some point, as the base gameplay has enough of an alteration in the top-down shooter genre to be worth something. The fact that your core can be attacked by yourself and the fact that enemies take you down in one hit, that's a nice change of pace for the genre, and does make it stand out a bit. The animation and art is great, even with characters like PewdiePie making an apperance. But where the game majorly suffers is variety: it's the same thing very, very quickly, and doesn't have the lasting power to keep your entertained over a long haul. The unlocks do small things to help, but enemy and arena variety would have gone a long way to help the game out: and it fails at it. And it doesn't help that the online play is ancient: this is 2016 and you're asking for IP host/join in game, with Steam as your base platform? Not a good move. In the end, I'd wait for a sale regardless, as while I had fun, I can't say that you're going to get your moneys worth at this current price, but eventually, you will.

Lists:
Positives:
Base gameplay is good. Solid controls, and some good powerups that can cause chaos.
Dying to one hit while the core doesn't means you can't just throw yourself in front of enemies; you've got to consider your own life, and the risks you take.
Like the fact that you can hit the carrot core in question. Makes skill shots around it mean something.
Good gameplay options in the options menu. If you hate yourself, turn on the weak carrot mode.
Can cause good chaos in the coop battle, reviving your friends while running for your life.
A good soundtrack......
Negatives:
Variety lacks. The game falls into a pattern that causes a bit of a problem over the long term: the main gameplay is the same variation of enemies and items over and over again, with not a lot to spice it up. After an hour of gameplay, you've seen the base content here.
It's 2016. If your game is host/joining via IP when Steam is the framework.....you're probably doing something wrong.
At the bloody difficulty, that's where the game starts seeing some problems in frame rate when you've got a lot on screen.
The Soundtrack really isn't used that well. You'll be hearing the same base music over and over again unless you go and change it yourself.
Multiplayer games are very very basic.
Visual effects don't really help for me. It's artificial in terms of value added.

reviewText:
I was really split reviewing this game.  It might have an audience, hell some might say I just have a poor taste in games for this review but heres some object and subjective
Pros:
Cheap, only Eight dollars (or whatever price it is in your country)
Pick up and play!  You don't have to worry about any background or tutorials.

Mixed:
Soundtrack.  I like the Acheivements music and the rest to me is meh or crap.  I really dislike the main song as it's just really high pitch and poor at conveying any action

Graphics: some of them are really detailed and nice for pizel art, but others (Namely that stupid dna place's exterior for example) are so simple and kind of boring to look at.

Locked at 60fps, making a 144hz monitor owner cry from neglect somewhere.

Cons:
Poor options;
No Resolution controls.  Even Slender a pretty incomplete game on the same engine (Unity) had this.
No Fullscreen option (Meaning no options between Windowed, Fullscreen/Borderless Windowed, and Fullscreened)       This is unexceptable considering that I am pretty sure that Unity has built in Windowed and Fullscreened modes.
You can ONLY switch between controller and Keyboard  THERE ARE NO MOUSE CONTROLS WHAT THE HELL IS THIS THE 1980's OR DOS OR SOME BS?!?
Also on this last point, guess what, IT WASNT LIKE THAT BEFORE!!!  The game was originally submitted for the Ludum Dare challenge with admittedly worse graphics but mouse controls making it feel a lot better.  But somwhere between that version and the Itchio beta versions it was changed to GAMEPAD AND KEYBOARD only.

And you know about that Gamepad/Keyboard only thing?  All the prompts seem to be controller only in game!  Thats right I get muted out of doing damage and guess what It shows to rotate the right stick!  WHAT RIGHT STICK GAME???????  WHERE ON A  KEYBOARD IS A RIGHT ANALOG STICK?!

Super repetetive gameplay, playing on single player made me prefer paint drying simulator now with doritos™ wall drying action.

And it's main thing is multiplayer which for a indie game is kind of suicide
Especially when said multiplayer is p2p or maybe local multiplayer only...  (Would be difficult on most setups unless you have one made for couch gaming)


Advertises Full controller support while seemingly no support for button prompts other than xbox controllers and none for a single dpad controller like a nes controllers. though honestly dont know why you'd try to play a twinstick with a controller like that.


Some others might think of my complaints as small, and that's fine but I value a pc game having good settings, proper control rebinding and other features that ARE SUPPORTED BY THE MOTHER ♥♥♥♥ING ENGINE USE IT!!!!!!!!
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Really, really, fantastic.  Simple to start with a difficulty that ramps up with a lovely snowball momentum.  Good luck with 250+ post kill gameplay!

We start off in a really cutesy world remniscient of my 1990's cartoon theme childhood full of Bug's Bunnies and Animaniacs.  The music is enticing, upbeat, and keeps you in action while you're playing the game.  I was unable to watch the introductory cinematic because I skipped accidently by pressing the spacebar, which I'm personally fine with.  Story always pales in comparison to the meat of the game: the gameplay!

Top down, arena based combat, protect the asset (Carrot) in the center of the arena.  ..Yes, you can destroy it yourself, should you so choose...  Twin-Stick shooting action with some powerups along the way.  Triple Shot, Super Speed/Super Attack Speed, Screen-Wide AoE Wipe, Protective Barrier, and more!

Really enjoyed this experience, global leaderboard, unlockable characters, powerup items purchased in the shop, etc.  Hope you'll enjoy it as much as I did!  If you enjoy games like The Binding of Isaac and Smash TV, you will definitely enjoy this game as well.

I picked this one up not expecting much, loved the cartoony look and the games personality right off the bat.

Music is really well done as well.

It's one of those games that you do the same thing over and over till you get better. Unlocking equipables and new characters along the way.

Point being for 4 bucks (on sale) I can see putting some hours into it on a night I just need to relax by shooting everything.

One of the biggest things that has me googling things is this game has some mysteries too it. If you see this one on sale and your like hmmm should I? Do you like cartoon voilence? Do you want some bullet hell while protecting a giant ♥♥♥ carrot? Then JUST try it. :) I'm Glad I did.

reviewText:
A Twin-Stick Action Arena Shooterhttps://youtu.be/7hzaLPD0KzE
+ Gameplay is fun and simple, kill the zombies, don't let them hit the carrot
+ A variety of fun power ups to mow down enemies
+ Co-op and multiplayer arena modes which you can connect with your friends online
+ Graphically the game looks great
+ Good soundtrack
+ Unlockable upgrades and characters keeps the replayability high with new power ups, accessories, and so fourth

- Content is severely limited, essentially there's only 1 endless arena with no goals or objectives apart from surviving as long as you can to get on the leaderboards. This gets repetitive fairly quickly.

reviewText:
It's a decent CO-OP game for the whole family.

Of Carrots And Blood is yet another Top-Down Shooter.The whole game is about defending your huge ♥♥♥ carrot from... well everything.The game is High-Score based and there are no levels to pass except the CO-OP ones, which are 4 FYI.

The game becomes very repetitive after few hours of gameplay.The only reason I kept playing for was to play every character, buy every item and hear every vinyl.

-The overall visuals of the game are well made and apealing to the eye.There is lack of details at some places which I noticed only after staring at the so called hub world" for several seconds.
-The characters are well made and there is a huge veriety of them.Sadly none have any special attacks which is very dissapointing.
-I found every item in the shop to be useful at some point...except one that I didn't bother buying.Figure that one on your own after buying the game.
-The music was awesome and every vinyl is worth the brains !
-I felt like an absolute beast using some of the power-ups.There is that awesome rewarding feeling about them.Can't explain it.

Didn't play online.Never will.The host/join system used for the multiplayer is so outdated that I felt old just by looking at it.

* Is the game good and worth the time? Absolutely
* Is it worth the money at this stage of the game? Nope...Only if there ware any passable levels and/or dedicated multiplayer servers and/or more enviroments to play on
date: but sadly it lacks all of those.\nI do recommend the game.I did have fun playing these 4 hours and after future updates I am sure that Of Carrots And Blood is gonna be worth well over 7.99$ !"

reviewText:
Fun Game, but a bit lackluster content wise. I haven't been able to play beyond single player, but I feel like there should be a description stating that if you want to enjoy at least 75% of the game, you need to have a buddy who also has it. A lot of the game modes are locked out of single player. The items in the game are fairly limited, perhaps each character has different items they can equip? I am not sure. I am in the process of creating a new character in-game but it takes time (or at least thats what the Dr. said, no idea).

I really wish there was some type of campaign mode, but it seems nonexistant. IF you play single player, expect to play the same one over and over, no other stages. Just 1. Now it is fun, at the time of this review, I got about 2 1/2 hours in the game. Its a good bit of fun, but I wonder about the longeity of the game.

At this point, I would still recommend it, because its fun shooting ♥♥♥♥ with carrots, but realistically, for the amount of game content, the price should be far cheaper, OR the game should come in packs of (2) so you can take advantage of all the multiplayer features.

reviewText:
MULTIPLAYER DOESN'T WORK

If the multiplayer in a game doesn't work then I am going to feel angry about that. Quake 2 online still works, Civ4 online still works, Heroes of Might and Magic 2 online still works and these games are over 20 years old!

I understand that a small dev team might not have the expertise to bring decent online to a game, its complicated and a million little things can bugger it up. Their is no easy solution or fix and most PC users will just download Hamachi to fix these issues but Hamachi is no longer free.

So now I have to pay to bandaid the problem with the game I also paid for? How about no. Risk of Rain had this exact same problem. Direct IP connections are just not going to work for the majority of people.

Multiplayer aside, how is the game? Well its a twin stick shooter with a giant object in the middle that i/we need to protect but can also accidently shoot due to friendly f-- no.

I don't want to believe it, twin stick shooters are the simplist form of enjoyable gameplay around. You don't even need to go out of your way to make a twin stick shooter game enjoyable, by its very nature its enjoyable so I am truly amazed that they ♥♥♥♥ed it up.

Friendly fire is always a pain in the ♥♥♥ in any game but it can enhance the gameplay when done right. Not doing it right however is a thing you are doing when you have us on a escort mission and we can kill the person we are escorting! In a frantic, monsters from all sides type of game, we are going to suicide, a lot!

I dunno, the graphics, voice work, music and presentation really sell the game but the actual gameplay and the non working online make this game a tragedy.

I had no expectations going in except that of course the game will be great. Twin stick shooters by their very nature are great and also featuring online? Sign me the ♥♥♥♥ up! But the online part is a lie and the gameplay is ♥♥♥♥ed up in a way that could be easily fixed and so this game comes so close, so close to being great but the first wave of buyers will be like me.
Burned by the whole experience and leaving negative reviews and unless the game is patched, fast, it will be a huge shame because genuine care and love seemingly went into this game only for no one to check if the handbrake was on before parking the car of the top of the hill that is steam front page.

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

reviewText:
Disclosure: A copy of this game was provided by the developers.

Of Carrots and Blood is a top-down arena-style shooter where you play as a rabbit protecting a carrot from waves of mutated monsters.

What, that didn't sell you?  OK, read on.

The art direction is fantastic with crisp, animated sprites, and the overworld reminds me a lot of the kind found in Super Mario Bros. 3.  The overworld essentially functions as the game's main menu, which is a cool integration of features and gameplay.

The meat of the game is the arena-style defense and deathmatch modes.  As such, the amount of fun you have with the game is likely proportional to how many friends you have playing with you.  Even in a failed mission, currency is saved so you can continue to make upgrades to your arsenal: unlocking more characters and equippable items during combat.

The game gets hectic very quickly, making for fast rounds whether you're playing with friends or against them.  But because the game delivers a lot of party-like elements in its gameplay, the amount of time and value you'll get out of the game is once again partially reliant on whether you have 3 friends to play with.

The only snag I've found so far is accidentally kissing my friend when playing 2-player co-op mode (I know that sounds ridiculous).  Sometimes I'm scrambling to clear the screen and end up accidentally running into my friend's character, where we end up locked in a kissing animation for a brief moment.  Luckily the kissing mechanic does play a useful role, which you can discover in the item shop.

Overall, the game delivers lots of intense shooting action.  The controls are a breeze to pick up and you'll get the hang of it in no time.  It's a great game for short play sessions, but it could also work as an amazing drinking game with a few buddies.  It's weird and funny and an all-around fun experience, and if you enjoy games of this genre you'll likely be charmed by the graphics and gameplay.

reviewText:
Going to have to give this a no for NOW. It honestly doesn't have enough content for single player to be worthy of a yes from me. I understand there is a lack of dedicated servers but the multiplayer requires opening ports and hosting a server (Very 2001).

Pros:

- Potential to be very fun
- Great Art Style
- Fun idea

Cons:

- Lack of Single Player Content
- Lack of Connectivity options
- No real graphic settings, couldn't shrink the window
- No real guidance
- Could do with negative in-level powerups
